verses.verse: Now it came<WH1961> about when<WH9201> Saul<WH7586> returned<WH7725> from pursuing<WH310> the Philistines,<WH6430> he was told,<WH5046> saying,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> David<WH1732> is in the wilderness<WH4057> of Engedi.<WH5872>"

Then David<WH1732> arose<WH6965> and cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> the edge<WH3671> of Saul's robe<WH4598> secretly.<WH3909>
And it came<WH1961> about afterward<WH310> <WH3651> that David's conscience<WH3820> bothered<WH5221> him because<WH5921> <WH834> he had cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> the edge<WH3671> of Saul's [robe].

So he said<WH559> to his men,<WH376> "Far<WH2486> be it from me because<WH4480> of the Lord<WH3068> that I should do<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> to my lord,<WH113> the Lord's anointed,<WH4899> to stretch<WH7971> out my hand<WH3027> against him, since<WH3588> he is the Lord's anointed.<WH4899>"

And David<WH1732> persuaded<WH8156> his men<WH376> with [these] words<WH1697> and did not allow<WH5414> them to rise<WH6965> up against<WH413> Saul.<WH7586> And Saul<WH7586> arose,<WH6965> left<WH4480> the cave,<WH4631> and went<WH1980> on [his] way.<WH1870>

Now afterward<WH310> <WH3651> David<WH1732> arose<WH6965> and went<WH3318> out of the cave<WH4631> and called<WH7121> after<WH310> Saul,<WH7586> saying,<WH559> "My lord<WH113> the king!<WH4428>" And when Saul<WH7586> looked<WH5027> behind<WH310> him, David<WH1732> bowed<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776> and prostrated<WH7812> himself.
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Why<WH4100> do you listen<WH8085> to the words<WH1697> of men,<WH120> saying,<WH559> 'Behold,<WH2009> David<WH1732> seeks<WH1245> to harm<WH9567> you'?

"Behold,<WH2009> this<WH2088> day<WH3117> your eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200> that the Lord<WH3068> had given<WH5414> you today<WH3117> into my hand<WH3027> in the cave,<WH4631> and some said<WH559> to kill<WH2026> you, but [my eye] had pity<WH2347> on you; and I said,<WH559> 'I will not stretch<WH7971> out my hand<WH3027> against my lord,<WH113> for he is the Lord's anointed.<WH4899>'

"Now, my father, see!<WH1> Indeed,<WH7200> see<WH1571> the edge<WH7200> of your robe<WH3671> in my hand!<WH4598> For in that I cut<WH3027> off<WH3772> the edge<WH3772> of your robe<WH3671> and did not kill<WH4598> you, know<WH2026> and perceive<WH3045> that there<WH7200> is no<WH369> evil<WH369> or rebellion<WH9567> in my hands,<WH6588> and I have not sinned<WH3027> against you, though you are lying<WH2398> in wait<WH6658> for my life<WH6658> to take<WH5315> it.
"May the Lord<WH3068> judge<WH8199> between<WH996> you and me, and may the Lord<WH3068> avenge<WH5358> me on you; but my hand<WH3027> shall not be against you.
"As the proverb<WH4912> of the ancients<WH6931> says,<WH559> 'Out of the wicked<WH7563> comes<WH3318> forth<WH3318> wickedness<WH7562>'; but my hand<WH3027> shall not be against you.
"After<WH310> whom<WH4310> has the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> come<WH3318> out? Whom<WH4310> are you pursuing<WH7291>? A dead<WH4191> dog,<WH3611> a single<WH259> flea<WH6550>?
"The Lord<WH3068> therefore be judge<WH1781> and decide<WH8199> between<WH996> you and me; and may He see<WH7200> and plead<WH7378> my cause,<WH7379> and deliver<WH8199> me from your hand.<WH3027>"

Now it came<WH1961> about when David<WH1732> had finished<WH3615> speaking<WH1696> these<WH428> words<WH1697> to Saul,<WH7586> that Saul<WH7586> said,<WH559> "Is this<WH2088> your voice,<WH6963> my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>?" Then Saul<WH7586> lifted<WH5375> up his voice<WH6963> and wept.<WH1058>
And he said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are more<WH4480> righteous<WH6662> than<WH4480> I; for you have dealt<WH1580> well<WH9186> with me, while I have dealt<WH1580> wickedly<WH9567> with you.
"And you have declared<WH5046> today<WH3117> that you have done<WH6213> good<WH9186> to me, that the Lord<WH3068> delivered<WH5462> me into your hand<WH3027> and [yet] you did not kill<WH2026> me.

"For if<WH3588> a man<WH376> finds<WH4672> his enemy,<WH340> will he let him go<WH7971> away<WH7971> safely<WH2896> <WH1870>? May the Lord<WH3068> therefore reward<WH9608> you with good<WH9186> in return<WH8478> for what<WH834> you have done<WH6213> to me this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>
"And now,<WH6258> behold,<WH2009> I know<WH3045> that you shall surely<WH4427> be king,<WH4427> and that the kingdom<WH4467> of Israel<WH3478> shall be established<WH6965> in your hand.<WH3027>

"So now<WH6258> swear<WH7650> to me by the Lord<WH3068> that you will not cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> my descendants<WH2233> after<WH310> me, and that you will not destroy<WH8045> my name<WH8034> from my father's household.<WH1004>"
And David<WH1732> swore<WH7650> to Saul.<WH7586> And Saul<WH7586> went<WH1980> to his home,<WH1004> but David<WH1732> and his men<WH376> went<WH5927> up to the stronghold.<WH4686>
